result.execSummary:
The defendant Antonio K Bell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 2 years bifurcated sentence.
Consecutive to: to 14CF1708

superMiscConds.notes: Obtain and maintain full-time employment.  No employment that allows access to any personal identifying information, social security number or credit card information.  Forbidden from performing tax preparation for others.

Provide DNA sample as required by law and pay assessed surcharge.  Pay costs of supervision and court obligations.  Cooperate with counseling, treatment and programs determined appropriate.  Comply fully with all Family Court orders.  No contact with victim, K.J.  Firearm prohibition warning given.  Voting prohibited until sentence has been completed and civil rights are restored.

No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances, except for those prescribed by treating health care provider.  Submit to random testing as required by agent.  Cooperate with AODA assessment and follow through with treatment, counseling and program recommendations.

Defendant Antonio K Bell in court with attorney Jennifer Marie Severino.  Gerad T Dougvillo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
The State is in compliance with Ch. 950. In 15CF43, the State files amended information. Defense acknowledges receipt of same and enters NG plea.
Upon plea to Ct 1 in 14CF1708 and amended Ct 1 in 15CF43, the State will DRI Cts 2 & 3 in 14CF1708. The State also agrees not to issue uncharged referrals. The State agrees to follow PSI and defense is free to argue.

Defense is asking that the condition of house arrest be removed or give deft 5 hours per week for deft to attend to personal business such as doctor appointments, grocery shopping and such. The State does not object to making some allowances but objects to taking the GPS off all together.

BTC: guilty as above. PSI ordered.
